text: are you just trying to add a js file to a template? you can use `{{ require_js('script/path', "footer") }}`
<@UECFPB6G1> Yep thats what I wanted to do. Thanks

Hey everyone :wave: we just pushed up a new minor release of boilerplate (<https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/releases/tag/v3.2.0>) that introduces some minor feature enhancements (removing `fallback.css`, inheriting from brand settings to theme settings, updating GH deploy action version + removing CLI from dev dependencies, and adding editable fields for blog tag/author headings). Please check out the release notes for more details!
what is the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/main/cms-deploy.yaml|cms-deploy.yml> file used for?

This is an internal file we use for deploying boilerplate to the design manager (e.g. if you go to create a new theme via design manager and choose boilerplate as a starting point). Would it be helpful to add a short page in the Wiki of the boilerplate to explain what the top level project files do?
That’d be stellar. I think devs would feel more comfortable deleting stuff like that on projects if they knew what it was. Thanks!
